Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: It’s one thing to say you’d never take a bribe: It’s quite another when your options are taking one or missing rent or going hungry. That’s but a taste of the moral quandaries in Papers, Please, which puts you in the shoes of a border checkpoint agent in a fictional 1980s nation. Learning to master passport processing skills, avoiding fines, and making the most of your paycheck is uniquely satisfying and provocative in a way few games manage to achieve. This celebrated indie gem teaches us as much about empathy as it does time management.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: Can you get away with murder?

editorialNotes.standard: You’ve got eight wickedly tense hours to get away with murder in this sublime whodunit. It’s a brainteasing delight bribing, framing, and wooing your fellow cruise-ship passengers. Should you chat up nosy Lady Honoria Armstrong or play cards with Carstairs in the smoking room? Every failed getaway encourages another try—one where you explore different areas at different times and engage in new conversations. Brilliantly written and immaculately detailed, Overboard! makes dabbling in deception great fun—and that’s the truth.

Reimagining the decades-old blockbuster of the same name, Castle of Illusion Starring Mickey Mouse revamps Disney's love letter to classic platformers with a fantastic new design. Whether you have fond memories of the original or this is your first romp through the manic lands of the evil witch Mizrabel, Castle of Illusion epitomizes fantastic platforming. It’s an outstanding return for Disney’s most beloved mascot.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: This is not relaxing. This is not simple. But it is so, so good.
editorialNotes.tagline: Beware: this game has no mercy

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Dead Cells is a celebration of perseverence: In this game, death is never final, but an essential learning tool. With every new run through ever-changing, enemy-infested levels, you get a little stronger and a little more skilled at overcoming relentless adversaries—and gradually overcome obstacles that once felt insurmountable. The acclaimed roguelike platformer makes all rewards feel earned; you'll be motivated to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

Not only is Knights of the Old Republic one of the best Star Wars games, but it's also regarded as one of the best role-playing games ever made. This version of BioWare's remarkable achievement features an interface adjusted for touch input. It lets you wield the Force and slash lightsabers across multiple worlds as you team up with brilliantly realized characters and follow an intriguing plot shaped by the choices you make.
Follow the story of the acclaimed anime—or hop straight into battle as your favorite heroes—in the action-packed mobile version of the 2008 fighting game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: From indie developer Evan Kice, Afterplace is an unforgettable RPG lovingly crafted for mobile, forgoing virtual buttons in favor of swipes and taps to control its precise combat. The game is also just a delight to explore, brimming with surprises ranging from sarcastic vending machines to nightmarish bosses. Even after two playthroughs, we’re still finding new paths, new choices, and unexpected encounters that make us laugh.
This turn-based RPG recalls the secret-filled dungeons of old-school classics—and adds contemporary tweaks like awesome lighting effects and a streamlined interface.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: For builders and tinkerers, the planet Woanope couldn’t be a better place to be stranded. It’s overflowing with flowers, crystals, animals, and a zillion other resources you can quickly craft into everything from comfy furniture to vicious weapons. A never-ending string of new locations and inventions keeps this survival RPG engrossing, and its oddball humor pulls you in even more. We looked forward to every wacky conversation with our robo-companion and random alien creatures—and to the awesome discoveries we’d make when they sent us on quests.
editorialNotes.short: Fight monsters. Chop down trees. Build new things. It's a survivalist's delight.

editorialNotes.standard: Control a massive arcade claw machine to grab knives, swords, and other handy items as you delve deep into this clever roguelike RPG.
Intuitive deck building, a sinister game show setting, and snarky quips from a malevolent Lady Luck keep us coming back to roll the dice in this fantastic roguelike.

editorialNotes.standard: Once again we're in awe of what the amazing minds at Simogo (Year Walk, Beat Sneak Bandit) have crafted. This ingenious blend of text adventure and interactive novel will have you flipping and twisting your device, re-reading previous story elements as you uncover new clues, and finding meaning in the seemingly insignificant pictures and audioclips that pepper your screen. If you crave mind-bending puzzles and welcome a hearty challenge, you’ll savor every minute of Device 6’s absorbing mystery.

editorialNotes.tagline: Be sure you're prepared for nightfall

name: Chroma Squad
artistName: Behold Studios Jogos Eletronicos LTDA ME

editorialNotes.standard: Experience an unforgettable tale of humans, gods, and Viking lore, presented as a wondrously intricate tactical roleplaying game. Beneath Banner Saga’s arresting hand-drawn graphics and stirring music lies a world where decisions matter—where conversational choices affect the plot and beloved characters can be lost forever in brutal turn-based battles. Within minutes, we were deeply invested in this fascinating realm, but a lengthy campaign full of action and surprises makes the journey captivating all the way through.

editorialNotes.standard: One of the most influential RPGs of all time, Final Fantasy VII takes you on an unforgettable journey through a harsh and unforgiving sci-fi landscape. Packed with tense turn-based combat and an extraordinary story, Square Enix’s masterpiece is as exhilarating now as it was when it was first released in 1997.

ios.subtitle: Live the life of a real dog!

editorialNotes.standard: Tend to crops—and find love—while revitalizing your hometown in this cozy made-for-mobile spin on the beloved farming simulator.

editorialNotes.tagline: Put an end to the terror

editorialNotes.standard: Mika Mobile has crafted a superb and wonderfully robust role-playing game in Battleheart Legacy. Each hero can equip a diverse assortment of abilities, ranging from devastating spells to adept swordsmanship and stealthy rogue attacks. The game’s flexible combat system allows you to freely mix skills and spells as you slay hordes of goblins, bats, and skeletons. Battleheart Legacy is a polished, beautifully animated game with a wealth of places to explore and plenty of ways to play.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: You don’t need a D20 to defeat enemies in this adorable throwback RPG, thanks to its novel dice-rolling system.

This game’s cheeky hilarity comes from the endlessly unexpected ways we perish during our trek to the zombie-free haven north of the 49th. Smashing our car in an ill-advised stunt jump, being abandoned by our rifle-toting dog, losing a pose-off to a bunch of burly bandits—you get the picture. This undead action-adventure just won’t stop gnawing on our funnybones.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
